primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: A cosmic rescue mission where God intervenes to liberate humanity from the grip of a superior Enemy (Sin/Death/Satan) who has rendered them 'dead'.

subject.identificatie: God (specifically the Triune God acting in Christ)
tekstueel_bewijs: God... made us alive together with Christ
The One who has sent his Son to rescue the 'children of wrath' is God.

object.identificatie: New life / Deliverance from the 'Body of Death'
tekstueel_bewijs: his gift of new and eternal life
brought 'out of error into truth, out of sin into righteousness'

zender.identificatie: God (The Writer of the Story / Providence)
tekstueel_bewijs: Tolkien called God 'the Writer of the Story.'
The One who is setting the ultimate conditions is God.
It is the story of the whole of humanity
the ultimate outcome, for all of us warring human beings, belongs to God.
Jesus Christ, who was triumphant over Satan on Satan’s own turf.
This other Power (which Christians have often called Providence) is ceaselessly working to defeat the enemy

tegenstander.identificatie: The Enemy (Satan / Prince of the power of the air / Sin / Death)
tekstueel_bewijs: the Enemy of God is a personal intelligence possessed of an implacable will
Sin and Death, those cosmic Powers of the Enemy of God
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is described as a 'personal intelligence' far stronger than all human wills combined, rendering humans 'dead' and unable to act.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The performance of 'good works' by the rescued humanity as a response to the primary program.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Rescued Human (The Workmanship)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program is strictly a consequence of the first; God prepares the works beforehand so the subject merely 'walks' in what is already provided.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God has already come to us
God has already prepared our good choices for us

voorbeelden: Let us brace ourselves to our duties.
He knows that being acclaimed as a hero is dangerous.
The Enemy, you see, is too strong for us.
God has accomplished something that we could never have accomplished.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the total lack of 'Pouvoir' (Power) in the human subject and the infusion of 'Pouvoir' from the Divine Subject.

primaire_tegenstelling.niet_s1: Human Effort/Moralism (The illusion of our vote)
primaire_tegenstelling.niet_s2: Righteous Outrage/Vulnerability (The path to the Enemy)

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From the illusion of human power (~S1) to the reality of being dead (S2), then to the intervention of God (S1) which annuls S2.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the 'Subject-switch': Christ takes the field because the human subject is dead.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; S2 is a cosmic power, not just a mistake.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is a textbook example of theocentric preaching. It explicitly rejects the 'two-party transaction' (moralism) in favor of a 'three-part cosmic drama' where God is the primary actor.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: God presents himself to us and then stands back and lets us decide.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of active verbs

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The Enemy... far stronger than the will or purpose of any human being.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical and contemporary figures (Sergeant Redmond) are used not as models to imitate by will, but as examples of those who recognize their own lack of power and God's prior work.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides a theocentric reading: Mary is an example of God exalting the humble, not Mary exalting herself.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and humility; removal of the burden of 'choosing' salvation.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation; God is the sole author of life.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the primary program (salvation) to the secondary (works) is perfectly handled via the concept of 'workmanship'.
spanning_punten: The tension between being a 'Christian man' and a 'killer' in war.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus Christ, who was triumphant over Satan on Satan’s own turf.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses more on the Father and Son, though the 'gift' implies the Spirit's work.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject. It avoids the trap of making the hearer the hero of their own sanctification.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is the 'Grammar of Grace'.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent is already sufficiently cosmic.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in avoiding moralism while addressing a highly charged political and ethical situation.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis might focus on the Iraq War metaphors; Greimas shows these metaphors function to define the 'Axis of Power'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Ephesians 2; Greimas shows how the sermon *replicates* the narrative engine of Ephesians 2.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Enemy' is a necessary actant to prevent the sermon from collapsing into a two-party moralistic contract.

appendices.notities: The use of Tolkien and current events serves to reinforce the actantial roles, not to distract from them.
